sister’s husband (male ego): aɕe jodpi kakaː, strĩːmo jodpi maqpa
sister’s husband (female ego): aɕe jodpi kakaː, nuŋo jodpi mĩːmo
husband’s brother: aɕi pubi kakaː, aɕi pubi pʰoːno
husband’s sister: aɕi pubi aɕeː, aɕi pubi strĩːmo
father’s sister’s son: nene buː, moːmo nene rereː foːno, dʑãːmo nene rereː foːno, dʑãːmo nene rereː mĩːmo
father’s sister’s daughter: nene boŋo, moːmo nene rereː strĩːmo, moːmo nene rereː aɕeː, moːmo nene rereː nuŋo
mother’s brother’s son: moːmweː buː, moːmo nene rereː foːno, dʑãːmo nene rereː foːno, dʑãːmo nene rereː mĩːmo
mother’s brother’s daughter: moːmweː boŋo, moːmo nene rereː strĩːmo, moːmo nene rereː aɕeː nuŋo
mother’s sister’s son: matɕuŋi buː, matɕuŋ rereː foːno, matɕuŋ rereː mĩːmo
mother’s sister’s daughter: matɕuŋi boŋo, matɕuŋ rereː strĩːmo, matɕuŋ rereː aɕeː nuŋo

mother’s father: mən nɑːn nɑː tɑː, tɑːi kata
mother’s mother: mən nɑːn nɑː nɑːn, nɑːni kata
brother’s wife (female ego): janga kuːtʃ, janga kuːtʃnɑː vru kuːtʃ

father’s older sister: ɔːlu maːmbiː, məɕər maːmbiː, məɕər ama
mother’s younger brother: salaːko maːma, suɽ maːma, kəɕər maːma
mother’s younger sister: suɽ χaːla, kəɕər χaːla, kaneʂʈi χaːla
father’s older brother’s wife: məɕər kaːk maːɕiː, ɔːli maːmbaːsa maːɕiː
father’s younger brother’s wife: kəɕər kaːk maːɕiː, kaneʂʈi kaːk maːɕiː, salaːki maːmbaːsa maːɕiː
